channel.title: Spawn wtf!

item.title: Spawn wtf!
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:9, topic:144874”][quote author=xx qwertyuiop xx link=topic=198480.msg1768377#msg1768377 date=1190264040]
take out this line,

if (newItemID <= 7500 && newItemID >= 0) {

and take out the last right curly bracket in the command.
[/quote]He’s removing the limits. Yes, it can cause crashes with bad item spawn IDs, but is a very easy fix. Where did you learn Java?

Where did you learn java? To fix this you need to replace 7500 with 20000. This allows you to spawn items up to 20000. I don’t understand what you are trying to do.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Spawn wtf!
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

just to clear things up

int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11));

means…
lets say
pickup 1234 1234567

pickup = 7 letters long
so thats why substring starts AFTER 7 letters so pickup word gets ignored.
It tries to get a number ONLY. from 7 to 12 places

12-7 = 4 so any ItemID past 4… like 10000 Wont work. becasue of the substring you are using you will most likely hit the exception/

now

you also have 1234567 as item amount lets say…
the below says
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12));

which lets say you use a 10k ++ itemID.

so pickup = 7 letters + 10k = (5 letters) = 12 letters. It will I guess trim the space out anyways but a better pratice would be to change 12 to 13.

I would also update the usage below

Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10
is old… you would have to update that message to
Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 00995 10

but use ownage plz’s command it can accept
::pickup 995 10 as well as ::pickup 10150 10 without any problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Spawn wtf!
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“xx qwertyuiop xx, post:6, topic:144874”]take out this line,

if (newItemID <= 7500 && newItemID >= 0) {

and take out the last right curly bracket in the command.[/quote]

Where did you learn java? To fix this you need to replace 7500 with 20000. This allows you to spawn items up to 20000. I don’t understand what you are trying to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Spawn wtf!
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 2) { try { String[] token = command.split(" "); int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(token[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(token[2]); if (newItemID >= 0 && newItemAmount > 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sendMessage("No such item."); } } catch(Exception e) { sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup # #"); } }

Read full topic

Use as ::pickup 0995 10");

item.title: Spawn wtf!
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_gun Andrew gun
item.description:
@Andrew_gun wrote:

When i use ::pickup 11275 1 it wont work!(It defender icon)
it alawyssays wrong syanx use 0995 10

Help

		}

if (command.startsWith(“pickup”) && (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Liam”) || playerRights >= 2)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7,11));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(12));
if (newItemID <= 7500 && newItemID >= 0) {
addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
} else {
sendMessage(“No such item.”);
}
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(“Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10”);

Read full topic
